summary.body: Anyone else suddenly being bathed in light from the new building on Chiswell Street called, I think, Milton Place. Seven dirty great floodlights have been switched on - and stay on 24 hours a day! They serve no useful purpose whatever. I no longer enjoy twilight falling softly - in fact, I can't look to the east any more as the lights dazzle so much.  Anyone else willing to join me in a protest to try and get them turned off? Quite apart from the intrustion, they are a supreme example of wasting energy!
summary.subject: Floodlights in Chiswell Street!

summary.body: Hello  Was anyone else disturbed by a very bright light shining from the top of that new building diagonal to Holmes Place on Aldersgate Street.  I live at the top of Bryer Court behind several layers of scaffold sheeting and my flat was as if a searchlight had been shone into it last night.  It went on for hours and hours.  I am afraid this is some dodgy new lighting put on top of that building at night.  Way too bright for comfort. Did anyone else suffer from it...?
summary.subject: STRANGE BRIGHT LIGHT SHINING FROM TOP OF 140 ALDERSGATE

summary.body: So there I was after watching Madonna's performance at the Live Earth concert from the comfort of my Mountjoy apartment last Saturday, vowing to never leave any electrical item on stand-by ever again, when I close my curtains to try and shut out every bit of light coming from all the office buildings that we're surrounded by.  What's the point in trying to make a difference in order to prevent global warming when all the office buildings around us can happily leave all their lights on 24/7? I don't know if anyone feels the same way, but I'd love to have more darkness outside at night time, so we can occasionally forget we're in the heart of a big city.
summary.subject: Light Pollution after Live Earth Campaign
